Docs.summary: Abandons a using a lock token. This will make the message available again for processing.
Docs.remarks: A lock token can be found in , only when is set to . Abandoning a message will increase the delivery count on the message. This operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver.

MemberSignature.Value: public int PrefetchCount { get; set; }
.property instance int32 PrefetchCount
Public Property PrefetchCount As Integer
member this.PrefetchCount : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Prefetch speeds up the message flow by aiming to have a message readily available for local retrieval when and before the application asks for one using Receive. Setting a non-zero value prefetches PrefetchCount number of messages. Setting the value to zero turns prefetch off. Defaults to 0.

remarks.para: When Prefetch is enabled, the receiver will quietly acquire more messages, up to the PrefetchCount limit, than what the application immediately asks for. A single initial Receive/ReceiveAsync call will therefore acquire a message for immediate consumption that will be returned as soon as available, and the client will proceed to acquire further messages to fill the prefetch buffer in the background.

While messages are available in the prefetch buffer, any subsequent ReceiveAsync calls will be immediately satisfied from the buffer, and the buffer is replenished in the background as space becomes available.If there are no messages available for delivery, the receive operation will drain the buffer and then wait or block as expected.
Updates to this value take effect on the next receive call to the service.

Docs.param: The options used to configure the settings of the pump.
Docs.summary: Receive messages continuously from the entity. Registers a message handler and begins a new thread to receive messages. This handler() is awaited on every time a new message is received by the receiver.
Docs.remarks: Enable prefetch to speed up the receive rate.

Docs.param: is the maximum waitTimeout for inflight message handling tasks.
Docs.summary: Unregister message handler from the receiver if there is an active message handler registered. This operation waits for the completion of inflight receive and message handling operations to finish and unregisters future receives on the message handler which previously registered.
